main event: A radar-detected object was found near Ouagadougou, Upper Volta (now Burkina Faso), Africa in 1962.
interesting points: The object was oval-shaped and white in color.
The observation of the object lasted 4-5 minutes.
The object was moving in a northerly direction.
The object was believed to be part of a disintegrated object, possibly a guidance control element.
The object was examined, and efforts were made to gain possession of the complete article, with a decision to be made on further disposition.
sighted object: an oval-shaped, white object detected on radar
location: Ouagadougou, Upper Volta (now Burkina Faso), Africa
